intro: Bulbostylis oritrephes, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bulbostylis, is a species of grass native to Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Bulbostylis. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is often found in regions with seasonal flooding or consistently wet conditions.
